meanings.definition: To take back possession of something by force or legal right.
meanings.sent1: The police reseized the stolen car from the thief.
meanings.sent2: After losing the ball, he quickly reseized it and continued playing.
meanings.sent3: The cat reseized the toy mouse, thinking it was a real prey.
meanings.sent4: She reseized control of the situation, turning the tables on her opponent.
meanings.sent5: The detective reseized the evidence, finally solving the case.

meanings.definition: To seize again; to capture or take hold of once more.
meanings.sent1: The eagle reseized the fish that had slipped from its talons.
meanings.sent2: He reseized the opportunity to apologize and make amends.
meanings.sent3: The child reseized the toy truck, determined not to let it go.
meanings.sent4: Time reseized its hold on the aging town, preserving its history.
meanings.sent5: The storm reseized the ship, tossing it around like a toy boat.
